Scotland is known for some of the most
unbelievably breathtaking scenery in the
world almost any great Scottish road
trip will begin right here in Edinburgh
making it an ideal destination for a car
rental to get going with that dream road
trip W marel and I don't typically go
for road trips they've always seemed a
bit overwhelming to plan in our opinion
with so much freedom to choose where to
drive and what to see along the way we
feel like we don't want to miss out on
anything Plus in the past dealing with
car rental companies has always been
such a nightmare that is until we
started using the sponsor of today's
video discover cars.com discover
cars.com has removed all of the hassle
and stress from the process of renting a
car for us we love having the ability to
search for the best deals across all
reputable car rental companies in
whichever City that we are looking to
rent with just one search on this
amazing website not to mention the
flexibility that there's search engine
allows us for example in this road trip
case we wanted to pick up a car in
Edinburgh Drive it all around the
highlands and then return that car to
another car rental in Glasgow at the end
discover cars.com made it so easy to
search for that scenario plus they offer
countless search filtering options to
help find the perfect car and price for
your trip checkout is also such a breeze
as there is no hidden fees and even free
cancel ation all you have to do is
confirm the booking and pick up your
keys on the day of your trip it's really
that easy so do yourself a huge favor
and use discover cars.com for all of
your road trip needs anyways we drove
about 1 to 2 hours to our first stop of
the trip which was Sterling

random stop along the way I feel like

after our magical morning with the
Highland cou we headed off on our next
leg of the incredible Adventure
something really awesome about this part
of the road trip was that it actually
required us to drive alongside Lochness
and yes that Lochness from the urban
myth about the sea monster this Lake to
the left of us was indeed the birthplace
of that legendary tale Scotland is so
full of history and stunning Landscapes
it's honestly so hard to not want to
stop and take pictures every 2 minutes
along the this drive but we did have to
stop real quick and admire this
breathtaking view of the ruins of this
ancient castle overlooking the legendary
Lochness from there we continued onwards
towards our next plan stop blasting a
lot of fun music along the way and
taking in all of the incredible views
it's only been 24 hours and W Marcel and
I have already realized that we are
absolutely in love with road trips
there's nothing quite like them that
allows you to appreciate the beauty of a
place that you are visiting constantly
throughout our drives over this journey
we have just talked about how grateful
we are to be doing and seeing all of
this maybe we've just fallen in love
with Scotland but I think we should be
doing road trips way more often anyways
there was another major stop along the
drive to our main attraction of the day
which is the Viewpoint called ragon pass
the drive up took us along this
incredible Winding treelined Road well
once we parked and got out to see the
view we truly couldn't believe our eyes
video cannot possibly do it justice but
all we can say that it was one of the
most pretty sites we have ever seen we
enjoyed it for as long as we could
before heading to the main stop of the
day guys this right here is called elen
Donan I can't even believe this is real
life it's stunning it's just stunning
everything we've been seeing today and
all along the drive is ridiculous and
this is
just Scotland continues to amaze me on
every single
level I can't believe
what continues to shock me along this
journey we've been on so far is the fact
that like it's crazy how much there is
yeah like there's literally like we've
passed probably three castles today and
and we had to choose one yeah we had to
choose one you can only choose one
castle one Castle a day yeah and it's
like how can this be so just common all
over I just love how much they've
preserved history in this place you know
it's incredible and it's incredible I
feel honored to be here experiencing
this it's just it's so beautiful so Beau
you like a berry what's that I don't

that wow babe
look at this

after enjoying our visit to elain Donan
we had to complete our drive to the
iconic aisle of sky before it got too
dark so we stopped by this Famous
Seafood restaurant named Fisherman's
kitchen for a cup of their awardwinning
homemade colon skink soup which we ate
in the hotel room later that night and
you guys it was truly lifechanging if
you're ever in the area it is a must but
anyways now was the Moment of Truth when
planning this road trip we must admit
that we were most excited for the fact
that we would get to visit the aisle of
Sky it's a stunningly picturesque Island
connected to Scotland via skybridge
which we were now Crossing and as we
drove across it we were absolutely
buzzing with excitement and we just
couldn't wait to get to sleep in our
hotel room that night so we could wake
up and start explore
[Music]
good morning from porry which is a town
in Sky yes and it's gorgeous this town
is so Charming so colorful and lovely we
need to show you right now so we're
going to explore a bit before we grab
some breakfast
[Music]
[Music]
he
[Music]
after loading up on that delicious
breakfast we got in the car and started
our drive to what spoiler alert turned
out to be the best hike we have ever
done in our entire lives the drive there
was so beautiful as usual here in the
highlands we even had to stop off and
admire these stunning Scottish goats I
mean look at the horns on them anyways
we parked the car and started the hike
which was called the old man of store I
don't know what kind kind of magic luck
we've had but the weather was absolutely
perfect for this hike I mean look at how
clear and sunny the sky was 5 minutes
into this hike the views were already
absolutely blowing us away I mean
honestly this is the stuff you see and
only the most sweet of dreams I don't
know if it was the elevation or what but
we got pretty winded very quickly I even
stopped to drink some water from the
stream that was running down the
mountain which could have been a bad
idea but it tasted great so it was fine
every step we took along this hike we
found ourselves overwhelmed with
gratitude and love it was honestly a
spiritual experience for us we found
ourselves thanking God over and over
again for blessing us with this
beautiful Earth the terrain felt so
surreal and mystical it felt like we
were walking on a movie set as we got
higher and closer up to the store rock
formation it honestly began to feel like
we were on another planet entirely I
mean look at this does it not look like
we could be on mars or just another
planet of all of our adventures we've
been on we could count on one hand the
amount of times we've been this blown
away and the beauty of it is that it is
completely free man didn't build this
nature built it and it's here in all of
its glory for us to appreciate we both
can honestly say that this was probably
our number one best nature related
experience so far in life hand it is the
most important thing that you must
include in any Scottish Highland road
trip but anyways after the hike we
headed back to the car to drive to our
next spot this one was one that I
personally have been dreaming of since
we started this adventure because it
just gives me such fantasy novel Vibes
and as we arrived I jumped out of the
car Beyond excited to find finally see
it in person

this point I know I don't have to say it
but the drive over was beautiful again
of course and as we pulled into the
parking space and walked over to the

finally got my first look at it
